meanings.sent2: She counted her feet and found she had ten.
meanings.sent3: The baby's feet were so tiny, they looked like little peas.
meanings.sent4: His dance moves were so smooth, it was like his feet were gliding on air.
meanings.sent5: The muddy feet left a trail of footprints across the floor.

meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to 12 inches.
meanings.sent1: The table was six feet long.
meanings.sent2: He measured the room to be eight feet wide.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched out to its full length of three feet.
meanings.sent4: The tree stood tall, reaching up to twenty feet in height.
meanings.sent5: The bridge spanned a distance of fifty feet over the river.

meanings.definition: The lower extremity of the leg below the ankle, on which a person stands or walks.
meanings.sent1: She hurt her foot and couldn't put weight on it.
meanings.sent2: He walked for miles on his tired feet.
meanings.sent3: The clown's oversized shoes made his feet look comically large.
meanings.sent4: She danced so gracefully, it was as if her feet were floating on clouds.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's feet pounded the pavement as he sprinted towards the finish line.
